Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on the Impact of Perivascular Adipose Tissue Preservation in Coronary Artery Bypass Grafting

Trial_Design.evidence: The unit of randomisation was the individual patient, with a sample size of 200 determined by power analysis.

Participants.evidence: Conducted at a tertiary care hospital, this randomised controlled trial included patients aged 18-75 diagnosed with CAD.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to either PVAT-preserved (intervention) or PVAT-removed (control) groups.

Objective.evidence: To assess the effect of PVAT preservation on graft patency and vasospasm.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was graft patency at 12 months post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation concealment was achieved using sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Outcome assessors were blinded to group assignments.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 200 participants were randomised: 100 to the intervention and 100 to the control group, with recruitment from January 2020 to June 2021.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis was conducted on an intention-to-treat basis, with 98 participants in the intervention group and 97 in the control group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The intervention group demonstrated a significantly higher graft patency rate (91% vs. 81%, p = 0.046).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were mild, occurring in 3% of the intervention group and 1% of the control group.

Funding.evidence: This trial was supported by the National Institutes of Health.
